item.title: Database Design for Products
item.description: Database Design: A Product-First Approach to Building Scalable Systems Over the years wrestling with database architectures I’ve learned that the most elegant technical solution isn’t always the right one. Database design is often viewed through the lens of technical optimization—normalized tables, efficient indexes, and query performance. While these technical aspects are crucial, the database disasters I’ve witnessed taught me that the most successful architectures emerge from a deep understanding of the product they serve.
